main event: Two witnesses observed a clear, orange-colored object in the sky over Centerville, Ohio on June 20, 1966.
interesting points: The object was viewed for about one hour, during which time it moved downward about 6 degrees and slowly disappeared as two saucers (turned upside down) came together.
The object was in the WNW sky and moved in a WNW direction.
The observers noted that the stars and moon conditions at the time were that there were a few stars visible and the moon was either bright or dim, but they don't remember the exact conditions.
The weather was clear, with no clouds or precipitation.
The object appeared solid, not transparent or vapor-like.
